titleStmt.title: Samuel G. Suddarth, Receipt to John Haly
CWG13682

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 11; Bundles of AG & QMG Expenditures 1864-65; Bundle 3

body.p:
NO. 12.
The State of Kentucky,
To John Haly, Dr.

row.cell: To. Two Coal oil lamps and 6 Dozen wicks
" One pair of shears 75¢ Two water Buckets 70¢
" Two looking Glasses $1,60 One Dozen empty sacks 15.00
" One load of saw dust 50¢ 2 Coffins, &, halling 2150/100
" Two Iron Tea Kettles 7 inches $225 Three pepper Boxes 60¢
" One Dozen Tea spoons $1.40 3 Dozen table spoons 3.00
" One Carver and fork $160 file 15¢ one large butcher Knife 75
" One Dozen Glass Tumblers $250 Two large waiters $4,580
" One large waiter $1.50 one Iron heater 75¢
" Two pair of socks $100 one pair of Drawers $1.25
" One Coffin, Lined, and halling $10.75 Gimblet 10¢

body.p: I certify that the above account is correct and just, and that the articles were furnished as stated, and were necessary for the public service.

Wm H. Gardner
Surgeon in Charge Hospital
Quarter-Master Gen. of Ky.

Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 21st of March, 1864, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter=Master General for the State of Kentucky, Eighty One dollars and -- cents, in full of the above account.
(DUPLICATE.)

18
NO. 12.
No 47 Abstract. G
Jno Haly
Dollars 81 X/100
Paid March 21 1864
Hospital
J 235
certif no 18
